jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline showcases its innovative power at Mobile World Congress

richtext.text:
Connected car experience R-link inside a Renault, shopping experience that skips the cash register at Geox store and Mobile proximity payments with NFC/HCE

Barcelona, Paris, 26 February 2014 - Worldline, an Atos subsidiary in e-payment and transactional services, demonstrates its innovative solutions around consumer cloud, e-payment, Connected Living and Digital Retail. During Mobile World Congress that takes place in Barcelona till 27 February, experts are present at its booth on the Government Catalonia Pavilion #CS50-19. Worldline is registered in several awards categories, including the connected Life Awards and Apps of the year.

Marc-Henri Desportes, general manager at Worldline: “In Worldline innovation is everywhere within the company. We highly encourage, reinforce and give worth to an innovative spirit internally, a culture that gives to the new value-enhancing ideas a chance and allows them to develop. At Mobile World Congress we demonstrate some tangible innovations implemented with our customers and ready to be used”.

Worldline, first actor to implement Connected Living

Initially focused on M2M, Connected Living is now growing towards Internet of Everything (IoE) new business models. Worldline improves IoE applications time-to-market, reduces complexity, lowers costs of operations and allows future-proofs investment, growing with the customer’s business. Worldline was the first actor to already implement Connecting Living for Renault R-Link with an Internet Of Cars system with a Mass Market Automotive eStore and the introduction of in-car payment.

Three innovations are demonstrated:

  • Connected Car experience – A Renault car is present at the event to show the new R-Link multimedia system. R-Link is an embedded multimedia tablet connected to Internet with a mass market automotive apps Store - more than 100 apps are now available- and the introduction of in-car payment.
  • Mobile experience Geox -Together with the city of Barcelona a mobile experience demonstration at a Geox store near the expo center is given, Passeig de Gracia, 52. It consists of various options: use smartphone with NFC tag, Tap&Pay, using NFC Technology, and buy through the application and get a QR code, or Scan&Buy, using image recognition to get extended information about the product, composition, colours, sizes.
  • Demonstration of mobile face-to-face payments with NFC Host Card Emulation mode - NFC is one of the several technologies that can enable the use of mobile for face-to-face payment. Worldline will demonstrate its capabilities in NFC mobile applications based on the newly supported Host Card Emulation (HCE) mode, notably for mobile face-to-face payments, as one of the choices open to banks and card issuers to enable Mobile Wallets.

About Worldline

Worldline, an Atos subsidiary, is the European leader and a global player in the payments services industry. Worldline delivers new generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with 40 years of experience, Worldline is ideally positioned to support and contribute to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. In 2013, Worldline’s activities within the Atos Group generated revenues of 1.11 billion euros. The company employs more than 7,200 people worldwide. worldline.com
